description:
It’s time to elevate your charging game with this recently released Anker GaN charging station that’s now $30 off on Amazon. Not only will this charger tidy up your desk, but it will also make your workspace look better thanks to the incorporated clock face.

Boasting a robust 250W output, this charging station features four USB-C ports and two USB-A ports so you can power multiple devices at once. Whether it’s your smartphone, tablet, smartwatch, or the rare occasion when your Kindle needs juice, this charger handles it all.

The charging station also features a small LCD display that shows you the current time as well as information relating to charging status and speed. There’s also a smart control dial on
title: Get $30 off on Anker’s newest GaN charging station for 6 devices

description:
Beige box on its side. Massive matching monitor. CD-ROM drive and a floppy disk drive underneath. This itsy-bitsy, teeny-weeny, off-white, boxy PC is a dead ringer for the first leftover computer my dad set up for me back in the early 90s. There’s but one difference: it’s six inches tall.

YouTuber Salim Benbouziyane (spotted by PCGamer and Yanko Design) made this thing from scratch by 3D-printing a case for a Raspberry Pi 4 and adding in an LCD screen in the monitor, plus a custom breakout board to get the power button and MicroSD card facing front on
title: This tiny Raspberry Pi-powered Dell PC just sent me back to the 90s

description:
We love seeing gaming laptops with RTX 4050 GPUs becoming more affordable, and this Acer Nitro V is the perfect example as its price drops to just $700 at Best Buy, down from its usual $950.

The Acer Nitro V features a 15.6-inch 1080p display with a 144Hz refresh rate, ensuring a smooth and immersive gaming experience as well as adequate screen real estate for work productivity.

Powered by an AMD Ryzen 5 processor, this laptop is the ideal choice if you want a balance between power and versatility. The 16GB of DDR5 RAM ensures plenty of speed for running and multitasking apps, games, and Chrome browser tabs.
title: Don’t miss this RTX-powered Acer gaming laptop for an absurdly low $700

description:
Four gigs of RAM might not seem like a lot for a PC or even a smartphone these days. But for a tiny all-in-one board like the Raspberry Pi, it can actually be overkill.

That’s why the company is releasing a new version of the Raspberry Pi 5 that chops the former base model’s RAM in half from 4GB to 2GB. The newer variant is a flat $50 — that’s $10 cheaper than the 4GB version and $30 less than the 8GB version.

Related: The $5 Raspberry Pi Pico is faster and backward-compatible

The memory isn’t the only thing changed in the new version of the design. It’s also using
title: The Raspberry Pi 5 is even more affordable with its new 2GB model

description:
One of the most annoying things ever is when I’m in a certain spot in my home or yard where the Wi-Fi connection is spotty. I could go two hours without issues, then suddenly it disconnects and flounders.

Well, this TP-Link Wi-Fi Extender is a solid solution for such a problem, and it’s only $13.30 at Amazon right now, down from its $35 MSRP. That’s a whopping 62% discount.

This is a tiny device that’s super easy to set up. You just plug it into an outlet that’s toward the outer range of your main router. Then, it basically boosts wireless coverage and provides a stronger signal to devices within the range of the extender.

Not only can you expand Wi-Fi coverage up to 1,200 square feet, but you can add up to 3
title: Get full-bars Wi-Fi signal everywhere in your home for just $13

description:
How many Steam Deck-style PC gaming handhelds is too many? We still don’t know because there are plenty still to come, apparently.

The Zotac Zone looks mighty familiar from the outside, but it’s bringing a few features that might turn heads in this highly competitive market segment — like an AMOLED screen, no upgrade required.

The Zone’s display isn’t any bigger than the competition at 7 inches, but it is a bit sharper than usual with its 1080p resolution and 120Hz refresh rate. The OLED panel is the highlight, though, offering more vivid colors and perfect contrast alongside 800 nits of brightness. (The Steam Deck comes in an OLED model, but only at the m
title: Zotac’s take on the Steam Deck includes OLED screen, built-in kickstand

description:
The school year is sneaking up on us and, believe me, you don’t want to be caught under-geared when the first day of class hits.

Whether you’re a wide-eyed freshman who’s entering college for the first time or you’re a seasoned student who has one final year to knock out, you’re going to need a solid laptop that offers reliable performance and long battery life. That’s just the facts.

That’s why Samsung’s current back-to-school sale is worth checking out. I’ve hand-selected the best Samsung laptop deals going on so you can save up to 30 percent on a laptop that fits your needs.

Best deals on productivity laptops
title: 5 awesome back-to-school deals on Samsung laptops

description:
For most people, installing Windows 11 is really quite easy. As long as you meet the hardware requirements and you have a legitimate product key, the Windows 11 installation process is straightforward.

Get Windows 11 Pro for cheap

Windows 11 Pro
title: Microsoft blocks trick that lets you install Windows 11 on older PCs

description:
If a ransom note suddenly appears on your PC screen, your PC has been hacked. But computer attacks are not always so drastic and clear-cut.

For the less obvious cases, you’ll need a finer sense and the right know-how. A quick solution is running a quick scan with your antivirus program of choice. If the tool detects a pest, then the matter is taken care of.

But sometimes the antivirus program doesn’t always locate the malicious code… and yet Windows behaves strangely. This is where you need to take a closer look at the symptoms.

Further reading: Best antivirus software 2024: Keep your PC safe from malware, spyware, and more
title: Has my PC been hacked? 5 ways to detect virus attacks, step-by-step

description:
Google is changing how Chrome extensions work on the desktop and Chromebooks. While the Manifest V3 changes are billed as ways to improve safety and efficiency, the way they also limit how adblocking extensions like uBlock Origin currently work has drawn a lot of criticism. 

I’m sure the fact that Google is the world’s biggest advertising company has nothing to do with it. 

Personally I’d recommend changing browsers. Chrome has been getting under my skin lately, so that’s exactly what I did, and there are plenty of alternatives that will remain compatible with current Chromium extensions for longer than Chrome itself.</
title: 4 ad blockers that still work with Chrome

description:
TL;DR: You’ll always have a charger for your Apple Watch when you attach it to the PowerBand. It’s now on sale for less than $30 through August 25.

Watching your Apple Watch hit the dreaded 20% battery level — or worse, 0% — is frustrating when you’re mid-run or while running errands. How else is it supposed to track your heart rate or step count?

But what if you could bring a charger for your Apple Watch anywhere you go? The
title: Charge your Apple Watch while wearing it with this $30 band
